docs.abstract: Bangladesh has the world's highest infant mortality rate, with more than two of every five babies dying within 28 days of birth, Health Minister Shamsul Huq said Friday. He told a pediatricians' seminar that many babies died because of inadequate postnatal care that led to respiratory and other infections.
docs.lead_paragraph: Bangladesh has the world's highest infant mortality rate, with more than two of every five babies dying within 28 days of birth, Health Minister Shamsul Huq said Friday. He told a pediatricians' seminar that many babies died because of inadequate postnatal care that led to respiratory and other infections.

docs.abstract: The death toll in a three-week cholera outbreak in Pirojpur, a southern coastal area, rose to 110 today, doctors said.
docs.lead_paragraph: The death toll in a three-week cholera outbreak in Pirojpur, a southern coastal area, rose to 110 today, doctors said.

docs.abstract: The military Government announced today that several local elections would be held between December and March. Opposition leaders have been demanding parliamentary elections to restore democracy, and they immediately opposed the local- election schedule, saying the parliamentary elections should come first.
docs.lead_paragraph: The military Government announced today that several local elections would be held between December and March. Opposition leaders have been demanding parliamentary elections to restore democracy, and they immediately opposed the local- election schedule, saying the parliamentary elections should come first.

docs.abstract: Supreme Court lawyers returned to work today after a one-day walkout to protest the arrest of their bar association president and to push for an end to martial law.
docs.lead_paragraph: Supreme Court lawyers returned to work today after a one-day walkout to protest the arrest of their bar association president and to push for an end to martial law.

docs.abstract: A senior army officer involved in the assassination of President Ziaur Rahman in 1981 was hanged in Chittagong Friday night, military sources said today. They said Lieut. Col. Fazle Hussain was one of 13 army officers involved in the killing during an attempted military uprising in Chittagong on May 30, 1981.
docs.lead_paragraph: A senior army officer involved in the assassination of President Ziaur Rahman in 1981 was hanged in Chittagong Friday night, military sources said today. They said Lieut. Col. Fazle Hussain was one of 13 army officers involved in the killing during an attempted military uprising in Chittagong on May 30, 1981.

docs.abstract: Three boats carrying flood victims sank in a storm, raising to 41 the death toll in weeklong floods throughout Bangladesh, officials said today. Sixty people are missing after their boat sank Friday during a storm.
docs.lead_paragraph: Three boats carrying flood victims sank in a storm, raising to 41 the death toll in weeklong floods throughout Bangladesh, officials said today. Sixty people are missing after their boat sank Friday during a storm.

docs.abstract: Sixty-three people were killed and more than 500 injured in fierce storms that swept several Bangladesh towns in the last week, according to a Government report issued today.
docs.lead_paragraph: Sixty-three people were killed and more than 500 injured in fierce storms that swept several Bangladesh towns in the last week, according to a Government report issued today.

docs.abstract: A passenger bus collided head on with a truck today, killing 20 people and injuring about 50 others. The crash occurred at Bhaluka, some 45 miles west of Dhaka as the bus was headed to the district town of Mymensingh.
docs.lead_paragraph: A passenger bus collided head on with a truck today, killing 20 people and injuring about 50 others. The crash occurred at Bhaluka, some 45 miles west of Dhaka as the bus was headed to the district town of Mymensingh.

docs.abstract: Nearly a dozen years have passed since Bangladesh won its war of independence from Pakistan with the help of India, and in that time the volatile Bengali nation has been unable to achieve lasting political stability.   ''That is our great misfortune,'' said a Bengali journalist here in the capital, where everything is under military rule and signs in the hotels remind guests of the nightly curfew.   Bangladesh, many here say, must have political peace so recent gains in food production, economic development and birth-control programs can be stepped up. As things stand, the country is just about able to keep its very low standard of living from sinking lower.
docs.lead_paragraph: Nearly a dozen years have passed since Bangladesh won its war of independence from Pakistan with the help of India, and in that time the volatile Bengali nation has been unable to achieve lasting political stability.

headline.main: IN BANGLADESH, THE PATH TO STABILITY IS UPHILL
headline.print_headline: IN BANGLADESH, THE PATH TO STABILITY IS UPHILL

byline.original: By William K. Stevens, Special To the New York Times

docs.abstract: Lieut. Gen. Hussain Mohammed Ershad, who proclaimed himself President Sunday, said today that martial law would remain in effect in Bangladesh until after presidential and parliamentary elections scheduled for next year.   ''Who will run the Government if there is no martial law?'' General Ershad said to reporters at an informal gathering in his official residence.   General Ershad, the chief martial law administrator, who took power in a bloodless military coup 20 months ago, said his move Sunday ''had no relation'' to the presidential elections scheduled for next May 24.
docs.lead_paragraph: Lieut. Gen. Hussain Mohammed Ershad, who proclaimed himself President Sunday, said today that martial law would remain in effect in Bangladesh until after presidential and parliamentary elections scheduled for next year.
